specimen.display: Biopsy - oral cavity, right buccal mucosa

conclusion: Invasive moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma, depth of invasion 8mm. Perineural invasion present. Lymphovascular invasion not identified.

presentedForm.data:
PATHOLOGY REPORT

Specimen: Biopsy, right buccal mucosa
Clinical History: 58-year-old male with non-healing oral ulcer

GROSS DESCRIPTION:
Received in formalin is a 1.2 x 0.8 x 0.5 cm fragment of tan-pink soft tissue.

MICROSCOPIC DESCRIPTION:
Sections show invasive moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma arising from oral mucosa. The tumor shows keratinization and intercellular bridges. Depth of invasion measures 8mm. Perineural invasion is present. Lymphovascular invasion is not identified.

DIAGNOSIS:
Squamous cell carcinoma, moderately differentiated (Grade 2)
Depth of invasion: 8mm
Perineural invasion: Present
Lymphovascular invasion: Absent
